gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19115-2 Geographic Information - Metadata - Part 2: Extensions for Imagery and Gridded Data

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: KN-195-10 Sediment Trap Fluxes of Th-234, POC, and PON in the Bering Sea
KN-195-10 Sediment Trap Fluxes of Th-234, POC, and PON in the Bering Sea

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: University of Rhode Island, Graduate School of Oceanography

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Graduate School of Oceanography, University of Rhode Island, South Ferry Rd

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The data in the accompanying file (Moran Sed Trap KN19510.xls) includes data corresponding to samples collected by the Moran Geochemistry Lab on the summer leg of the Bering Sea Ecosystem Study-Bering Sea Integrated Ecosystem Research Program (BEST-BSIERP) study from 14 June 2009 to 10 July 2010 aboard the R/V Knorr. BEST-BSIERP together are the Bering Sea project. Data are organized by station and sample depth, with station position (latitude and longitude) also included. This dataset includes the following: 234Th, Particulate Organic Carbon (POC) and Particulate Organic Nitrogen (PON) vertical fluxes. The thorium fluxes are in units of dpm (disintegrations per minute) m-2 d-1. POC and PON fluxes are in units of mmol m-2 d-1. In addition are the deployment and recovery times and positions.

gmd:keyword.gco:CharacterString: EARTH SCIENCE > OCEANS > OCEAN CHEMISTRY > ORGANIC CARBON
